sentences: Ma ei usu, et ta võib unustada. (past tense unustas)
Me peame unustama selle vastuse. (infinitive unustama)
context: The word 'unusta' is the imperative singular form of the verb meaning 'to forget'. In Estonian, this can be used as a command to someone (singular) to forget something. The root verb in infinitive form is 'unustama', and past tense would be 'unustas'. It's commonly used when telling someone not to remember or recall something.
